sect2.title: "/etc/ppp/peers/synce-device: No such file or directory" when running synce-serial-config
sect2.para: This is usually caused by not having ppp correctly installed on your system. Check that you have installed the "ppp" package for your operating system.

sect2.title: Linux freezes after connect using USB on SMP machines.
sect2.para: From version 2.4.8 Linux kernels have support for USB connection to Windows CE and Pocket PC devices. However there is problem on SMP machines running 2.4.18 (and probably some later 2.4.X kernels) that causes the kernel to lock. You need to patch the usb code and recompile the kernel. Instructions on how to do this can be found on the Synce web page.
